The Senior Software Engineer will be responsible for directing and selecting best practices for Hydro-Gear’s Software Development Team. This technical role will have the opportunity to be at the forefront of converting drive products from traditional hydraulic to highly efficient, environmentally friendly electrical traction.
The Senior Software Engineer will be integral in determining the long-term direction for our software products and assist our customers and end users transition into the electrification arena. This position is ideal for an individual that enjoys mentoring less experienced technical employees to become key players on the software team.
The Senior Software Engineer will have the freedom to implement a software development process for new products, update existing software and provide support for customers using the software/products. The Senior Software Engineer will support the Software Team Leader and requires collaboration with other business functions including Marketing, Sales, Accounting and Operations.
Skills Preferred
Strong knowledge and extensive experience in C/C++. Knowledge of C#/.NET, HTTP, CSS, Javascript, Node JS, etc., is a plus.
Experience writing product requirements and assisting with the development of firmware for embedded projects and required bootloaders
Experience in software development methods such as Agile, RAD, and Scrum
Strong knowledge of software testing including unit testing, integration testing, regression, etc.
Experience with writing self-documenting code (for example, Doxygen), and an understanding of software/firmware maintenance and versioning
Knowledge of the development of various communication means including CAN, SPI, serial, I2C, Bluetooth, Wi-Fi, etc.
Experience with embedded design, including HW and firmware specification utilizing 16/32-bit microcontrollers such as those from ST Micro, Microchip, etc.
Knowledge of real-time operating systems, multi-threading, inter-process synchronization using mutexes, semaphores, handling time-critical processes, etc.
Ability to develop and mentor inexperienced technical individuals
B.S. in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or a related technical field.

Location

Wilton - CT, US

NEW Job ID: J-00272985-305
Introduction to the job
Join ASML Wilton today to receive your sign on bonus and relocation.
Offer valid for Wilton, CT new hire offers made between now and June 30, 2023.
ASML US brings together the most creative minds in science and technology to develop lithography machines that are key to producing faster, cheaper, more energy-efficient microchips. We design, develop, integrate, market and service these advanced machines, which enable our customers - the world’s leading chipmakers - to reduce the size and increase the functionality of their microchips, which in turn leads to smaller, more powerful consumer electronics. Our headquarters are in Veldhoven, the Netherlands, and we have 18 office locations around the United States including main offices in Chandler, Arizona, San Jose and San Diego, California, Wilton, Connecticut, and Hillsboro, Oregon.
This position requires access to controlled technology, as defined in the Export Administration Regulations (15 C.F.R. § 730, et seq.). Qualified candidates must be legally authorized to access such controlled technology prior to beginning work. Business demands may require ASML to proceed with candidates who are immediately eligible to access controlled technology.
Role and responsibilities
As a quality engineer you take responsibility for providing insight into the quality of the department’s development processes and deliverables. This includes driving quality improvements in reporting, way of working, tools, root cause analysis, and training. You also have the opportunity to help shape a new quality role within a design and development organization.
Education and experience
Bachelor's, Master's, PhD in Applied Physics, Electrical, Mechanical, Optical, industrial, manufacturing or Mechatronic Engineering or equivalent experience.
Bachelor's with minimum 5 years' experience.
Master's with minimum 2 years’ experience.
PhD with minimum 1 year experience.
Required technical skills Data Visualization/Data Science (Machine Learning)/Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) skills (e.g. Python, Tableau, Spotfire, MATLAB, JavaScript, MS Access, My SQL, Minitab, JMP, Statistics, VBScript, C, R Studio, SAP, BAAN, Oracle, Advanced Excel, C++).
Knowledge/hands-on experience with software/technical tools like Microsoft office suites. Especially, deep data analysis using excel and its macros.
Skills
Working at the cutting edge of tech, you’ll always have new challenges and new problems to solve – and working together is the only way to do that. You won’t work in a silo. Instead, you’ll be part of a creative, dynamic work environment where you’ll collaborate with supportive colleagues. There is always space for creative and unique points of view. You’ll have the flexibility and trust to choose how best to tackle tasks and solve problems.
To thrive in this job, you’ll need the following skills:
Can observe and respond to people and situations and interact with others encountered in the course of work.
Can learn and apply new information or skills.
Must be able to read and interpret data, information, and documents.
Strong customer focus and commitment to customer satisfaction through prioritization, quality, efficiency and professionalism.
Ability to complete assignments with attention to detail and high degree of accuracy.
Proven ability to perform effectively in a demanding environment with changing workloads and deadlines.
Result driven-demonstrate ownership and accountability.
Identifies bottlenecks and drives improvements.
Work independently or as part of a team and follow through on assignments with minimal supervision.
Demonstrate open, clear, concise and professional communication.
Ability to establish and maintain cooperative working relationships with manager, co-workers and customer.
Work according to a strict set of procedures within the provided timelines.
Soft skill requirements: Commanding knowledge of English (verbal and written).
Drive for continuous improvement and making use of the lessons learned.
Convince others of your ideas.
Change management skills.
Strong analytical ability with a pragmatic attitude.
Ability to work proactively and independently.
Ability to multi-task and efficient in time management.
Excellent verbal communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work in a team environment.
Works in medium sized teams. Assists junior engineers (1-2 FTE). Independently working as a Quality specialist. Able to motivate, steer small teams (3-5 people, e.g. RCA).
Highly motivated, enthusiast, flexible and a good communicator.
Result driven, good organizational, planning and prioritizing skills.
Think broad, learn fast, take responsibility, act decisive and show critical sense.
Ability to work in multidisciplinary team(s).
Drive for continuous improvement; making use of the lessons learned.
Bring the Voice of the Internal/External Customer (VoC) into the department by providing feedback from customers, customer service, factory, supply chain, and integration to the department. Improve the Feedback Loop/Operational Excellence. Provide on a regular basis insight on performance in terms of parts usage, product performance, quality sensitive elements in design process adherence.
Diversity & Inclusion
ASML is an Equal Opportunity Employer that values and respects the importance of a diverse and inclusive workforce. It is the policy of the company to recruit, hire, train and promote persons in all job titles without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, or gender identity. We recognize that diversity and inclusion is a driving force in the success of our company.
Other information
